{"id":943060832,"question_id":583,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 1 month","timestamp":1683009220,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/943060832/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Delete Operation for Two Strings","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minDistance(String word1, String word2) {\n        int m= word1.length();\n        int n = word2.length();\n        \n        int[][] dp = new int[m+1][n+1];\n        for(int[] d : dp)\n            Arrays.fill(d, Integer.MAX_VALUE);\n        \n        for(int i=1; i<=m; i++){\n            dp[i][0] = i;\n        }\n        \n        for(int j=1; j<=n; j++){\n            dp[0][j]=j;\n        }\n        \n        for(int i=1; i<=m; i++){\n            \n            for(int j=1; j<=n; j++){\n                \n                if(word1.charAt(i-1)== word2.charAt(j-1))\n                    dp[i][j] = Math.min(dp[i][j], dp[i-1][j-1]);\n                \n                dp[i][j] = Math.min(dp[i][j], dp[i-1][j]+1);\n                dp[i][j] = Math.min(dp[i][j], dp[i][j-1]+1);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return dp[m][n];\n    }\n}\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"delete-operation-for-two-strings","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
